title: Citibank China Expands Presence in Dalian
summary: Dalian – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citibank") today opened its first sub-branch in Dalian. The new sub-branch is Citibank's first Smart Banking outlet in the city and is designed to provide customers with a unique and superior banking experience. Jonathan Larsen, Head of Consumer Bank and Cards, Citi Asia Pacific, Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer, Citi China, and Simon Chow, Country Business Manager of Consumer Bank, Citi China, attended the opening ceremony.
tag-1: Citibank China Expands Presence in Dalian
tag-2: Dalian – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citibank") today opened its first sub-branch in Dalian. The new sub-branch is Citibank's first Smart Banking outlet in the city and is designed to provide customers with a unique and superior banking experience. Jonathan Larsen, Head of Consumer Bank and Cards, Citi Asia Pacific, Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer, Citi China, and Simon Chow, Country Business Manager of Consumer Bank, Citi China, attended the opening ceremony.
tag-3: Jonathan Larsen said: "We are continuing the strong momentum of expansion in China for our retail branch business, and today's opening underscores our confidence in the ongoing economic advancement of Dalian and north-east China. By introducing this state-of-the-art Smart Banking outlet, we bring innovation to our growing customer base here that makes banking and wealth management services more relevant and accessible."
tag-4: Andrew Au said: "Given the importance of Dalian in north-east China, Citi has been expanding across multiple lines of business in the city. We already have a branch in Dalian and a lending company in Wafangdian, as well as branches of Citicorp Software and Technology Services and Citi Data Processing Center. Citi is committed to continued investment in China, and the opening today embodies our dedication of growing with Dalian's construction development progress as it seeks to become a regional financial center."
tag-5: Citibank's Dalian Xinghai Bay outlet contains a range of customized service offerings:
tag-7: Like all other Citibank outlets in China, the new outlet in Dalian offers both Citibank and Citigold services. Customers using the Citibank service, which requires a minimum balance of RMB80,000 will be provided with a choice of a comprehensive range of services to manage their wealth. Products offered include savings, deposits, investments (including Premium Accounts, Structured Investment Accounts and QDII products) and agency sale of insurance; as well as ATM / debit cards. Customers can also conduct their banking at their convenience through the multiple electronic channels, such as online banking, mobile banking, 24x7 phone banking and fax banking.
tag-8: The outlet also features a Citigold Service Center, designed to provide leading wealth-management services. The Citigold offering, which requires a minimum balance of RMB500,000, is distinguished by additional services, including:
tag-9: Simon Chow said: "We are delighted to introduce Dalian customers to a new style of retail banking which we believe will provide a superior customer experience. Citibank has built a track record of delivering innovations in China that distinguishing our service offering to customers. We look forward to our customers in Dalian enjoying the benefits of Smart Banking services."
tag-10: The Dalian Xinghai Bay outlet houses 12 retail banking professionals. It is located at Unit 13, No 451, Zhongshan Road, Shahekou District, Dalian.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-12: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has twelve corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing and Changsha - and thirty-nine consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
